title: (x) Rönisch Pianos logo - Adobe Caslon {Jan E}
content:
hi guys,

can anyone advise what the font is for “Ronisch” on the attached image please.

thanks heaps.

mike

author: mike_from_nz

comments.content: hmmm... my version of baskerville has pointy serifs?

I was totally off track.  
It’s Caslon, probably from Adobe.

you are right - adobe caslon regular SC matches very closely on my mac.

thanks heaps.
I think it’s Adobe Caslon Semibold. Since it’s all caps the SC doesn’t matter much.

<cite>Since it’s all caps the SC doesn’t matter much.</cite>

Whoa, hold it right there, pardner: SC’s (real ones) are different glyphs than caps — mostly somewhat darker in color and a little broader. Mixing them up is a no-no for a real typo-cowboy.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Howdy Bert.

I know what small caps are.  
It’s just that the sample is set in ALL CAPS.  
And the REAL CAPS are the same in SC and Regular.  
So it doesn’t matter if it’s SC or regular lower case.

Alright, pardner?

No offence meant, pardner – how about a drink in the saloon?  
. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
